text: Australia Prepared, as preserved by the Australian War Memorial organization Australia Prepared is a 1916 Australian documentary film to show the country's preparation for World War I. It was inspired by the British propaganda film Britain Prepared (1915) and was commissioned by Senator George Pearce. Filming took several months. Unlike many Australian silent movies, a copy of it survives. ==References== ==External links== *Complete copy of film at Australian War Memorial *Australia Prepared at Australian Screen Online Category:World War I propaganda films Category:Australia in World War I Category:Australian films Category:1916 films Category: Films from Australasian Films Category:Australian silent feature films Category:Australian black-and-white films Category:Australian documentary films Category:1916 documentary films
title: Australia Prepared
